storyInfo: The ragtag band of accomplices stops at a nomadic platform for supplies en route to the Grinning Valley. The skittish and terrified Jerry is worried that a certain someone might catch up to him after he skipped out on his engagement, and is equally scared that the security officers from the checkpoint are out to get him. During the wild chase, he happens to find himself hiding with a woman, and the two develop feelings for each other.

attributes.text: Life itself is a sort of profound horror.
You don't know where it's going to take you. Even worse, even when there aren't thirty-some-odd siblings and hundreds of other relatives clamoring to make your decisions for you––
You still sometimes find yourself under attack, out of nowhere. Such as, uh... right now.
There are no think tanks, no 'there's no way this could be wrong because everyone believes it,' only a bandit pulling up with a crossbow and the sand kicking up as hard as he drives.

attributes.content: Um, I... don't think we can pass through Windy Beach. That place is Catastrophe central. Each year, up to seventy thousand trucks are damaged or destroyed when passing through...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: But, that's not the point. Our transport's already pretty beat up...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: A-Also, you should take a look at this. In addition to Catastrophes, there are other factors that can worsen the damage to a vehicle...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Originium fuel leakage, transmission failure leading to secondary incidents, explosions in close proximity to mining sites... So we'll want to steer clear of the mines
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Hey, are you listening?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: That's right, Potlid. Climb up from here, saw off the branch, then connect the hose to the top of the tree!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The saw... is so heavy...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But it's okay... the ankle braces Lanns gave me are very secure. Just imagine that you're a big tree musbeast, use the braces to hold onto the tree, and jump up with a 'whoosh'...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: ...I know I can do this, and make everyone happy.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Huh...? My back feels lighter all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oi, jacker. I didn't tell you to do that.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Sure. You didn't tell me to do anything. But, I have experience collecting water from bottletrees.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Okay, so you have a heart after all. But I still need you to return Potlid's tools.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: After all, I certainly trust my old partner a whole lot more than I trust the random jacker.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Heehee...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Besides, it's not like we're really trying to become a bottletree water delivery truck.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: We just need to put on enough of a disguise before entering the city that nobody can tell it's an intercity transport that's gone off route.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Slap some decoration on as well –– don't let anyone see that the ol' girl's been punched full of holes before being patched over with sheet metal.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Potlid, let's go over our cover story with the jacker here.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: If anyone asks, tell them we're transporting this bottletree, and the water in the trunk's gotta be bucketed up for transport into the factory. As for the tree branch decorations on the vehicle, it's just a little something the boss enjoys.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: That's right. Bulletproof cover story, if I do say so myself.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Haha, never would've imagined that these bottletrees would be saving our hides when we're running from Catastrophes on our long 'detour'.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Whoever decided to plant these bottletrees in the middle of nowhere, thank you.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: And of course, that includes me as well.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: All righty, time to hop back into the driver's cabin!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Uhh... are you listening to me? Umm, I just want to remind everyone that...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Every year, three hundred thousand people suffer fractures aboard transport vehicles for various reasons, fifteen thousand of which are attributed to bottletrees tipping over in transit.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Just ignore him. I'll start the water pump slowly so there's no risk of falling off the tree.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But, accidents always happen...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Alright, I'm starting 'er up! Hold on tight, Potlid!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Every year–– Every year, there are a thousand more people–– who die to tree trunks bending during sudden strong wind––
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I did it, Lanns!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: The pump's starting to hum as it drains the water out of the tree trunk! Heehee, I love when this happens!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Hah, why else would I say I trust you?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Umm, actually, there's a chance the water pump might explode as well...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: What's your deal? Is that a death note you're holding or what?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Every year, I hear about an old friend or two who ends up contracting Oripathy or gets caught up in a Catastrophe, regardless of what field they work in. No avoiding it. If we go by what you say, we're all better off not working in the first place.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: S-Sorry... I just wanted to give you some... points of reference from my limited knowledge and experience. Just trying to help.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I, I... do marketing for an insurance company...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: 'Insurance'?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's the best thing I've seen advertised in years! I've already bought a bunch of policies, and hope to get this Columbian company's name out there.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: But I... I'm a bit skittish, afraid of everything.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: But there's insurance for everything I'm scared of, including dangers I had no idea even existed.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Look, these are my notes... Data collected from several of our company's advertisements, telling you about all the dangers you wouldn't ever think of!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Also, they promised to compensate me in the event that something actually does happen.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Cool. So, how do you plan to spend that money if you're dead? It'd be pretty cool if they invented a way to continue living after you die though.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Uh, I'm afraid... there's not much we can do about that.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Then, what's the point?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Listen up. You help dress the vehicle up, and we'll take it on over to the nearby nomadic platform. Need to check if a buddy of mine is home.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: How many vehicles run into Catastrophes each year, and where? Doesn't mean shit to me. I'll just ask her straight up for a safe route to the Grinning Valley safely, and that'll be the end of things.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Ugh... How'd we even get to this point?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I thought the little girl would just hide quietly in the vehicle, so all I had to do was squeeze into a tool room with her. Felt like the safest thing at the time...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...But then she wanted to go visit friends and relatives with Alanna, leaving me alone in the vehicle.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Here I am... alone in a hijacked transport harboring Infected people, forced to work, getting shot at with rocket launchers more than once!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I-I-I-I can't handle these people chasing me!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: So, I don't care who it is, who I have to follow. Just don't make me deal with this whole mess alone...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Th-Th-Th-This is all the m-m-money in my wallet. Here, take the whole thing! Please!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I, I never said I wasn't willing to follow you! I mean, it's only natural to not want to be a hostage, right...?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Hostage?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: I, I get it. You're the jacker, so if I go with you, I'll end up a hostage. But, you were so cool when you saved those people, like a real highwayman...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Th-That's not what I meant! I'm just trying to say you're really impressive!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Me? Impressive?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Wh-Why yes, that's right...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Umm... You're not mad, are you? Thank goodness.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Um, there is one thing I wanted to ask you. Alanna let you leave to buy the supplies we need to make the long-distance trip... So, can we just do it like that and not resort to robbing people?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: See, I've even given you my wallet now. There might not be much money in there, but it should be enough to cover food and fuel...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Phew... That's a relief.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Oh, right. Something was rubbing me the wrong way. You know how the men at the checkpoint were looking at us funny?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I'm a professional. Do you think... that we're already under suspicion?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: It's just – I never said I wanted to take a hostage. I said anyone who wanted to get off was free to go.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Why don't you go?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Umm... Huh? I thought I told you before...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I want to go to the Grinning Valley. That has nothing to do with you.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: It's a long and dangerous journey, and I knew that going in. Which is why I gave you the chance to hop off.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: You're scared of danger, so why are you still here?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Well, since you're such a nice person, would you mind coming with me to have a look at the newsstand?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I can explain...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: No... Normally, this wouldn't be...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Ray, my face is hidden by the newspaper, isn't it?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Okay, now let's take a good look here...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Phew. Great, I haven't made it onto the list of missing persons yet.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Though, uh, even if they did realize someone was missing, it wouldn't make it into the papers within a single day...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: What about wanted persons?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Not seeing anything––
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: It, it isn't what you think!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I just...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...skipped out on my marriage.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Well, it's not that I got cold feet. I was taking this transport, on my way to attend my engagement ceremony in another city, when you hijacked it...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: But then... I realized I was pretty happy about that.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Heh. Though, I guess that isn't some big deal either. And because it's not a big deal, I'm kind of embarrassed to talk about it...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I dunno how it is with your family, but in my case, I've got thirty-six brothers and sisters, and lots of other relatives... So you find plenty of stuff ends up not worth talking about...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Alright, so maybe you don't get it. I also know there are lots of people with huge families that don't deal with this sort of thing.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Sorry, can't help you with that one...
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: ...Hold on, Ray. There are uniformed men coming this way. The same as the last checkpoint...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I didn't grow up in a big family.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Those houses, all joined together neatly, looked so beautiful. But, I didn't know where I ought to settle myself down.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: The Zalak's gone.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Hm, he probably decided to leave on his own. Should've hopped off to begin with.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Good day, ma'am. We'd like to have a little chat with you.
attributes.name: Uniformed Worker

attributes.content: Don't be scared, Potlid. The pictures on the wall might be a bit spooky, but the lady here isn't into anything too weird.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: She takes pictures of giant beast carcasses in the primordial forest, plus the bones of explorers in the morass, but she's never hurt anybody.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Haha, well, at least, she probably wouldn't hurt anyone.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Huh. You're not even talking back when I call you Potlid. Where'd your spirit go? You hungry or something?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Dunno if we can count on the jacker at all, but hopefully she manages to bring the stuff back without any issues. I'll show you a neat hack later – you can use solar panels to fry up some instant noodle cakes and fowlbeast eggs!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ...Put the past behind you.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Anyways, I have a solution now. Doesn't the jacker seem odd to you? Maybe even... a bit crazy? That's why I decided to meet this friend and ask her about the situation.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: A shadow as tall as a mountain? And it can talk? If a thing like that really exists in Rim Billiton, my friend surely would've heard of it.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But, if the jacker simply had too much to drink, or went into the mines without a helmet and hit her head, well... I'll have to figure something else out.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Don't worry. They don't call me 'Alanna of the Barrenlands' for nothing. I'll always figure something out.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Get lost, and be quick about it. I'm busy with my travel notes. Didn't you see the sign on the door?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: ––Wait, not many know about my temporary studio in the first place. Which rag do you work for? And how'd you manage to track me down?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Lanns... Didn't you say you were old friends? She doesn't seem to... recognize you.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Haha, well... the 'old' part means we haven't seen each other in a long time.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hey, remember that time we went down to Big Hammer Mine? There was that one manglerbeast trying to tear us apart. Reckon that was the biggest manglerbeast known to man?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Right, right, it's the one on the wall there! I was behind the wheel when you took this photo.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Alright... I don't care who you are or what you want, but I'll give you ten minutes. Don't test my patience.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.text: Sorry to occupy your precious time, but I have to vent a bit – this is the single darkest day I've ever suffered.

Of course, I know that 'you' don't actually exist; I've just gotten used to having someone to talk to ever since I was little. After all, there were always so many people talking at once back home, and I... had the faintest voice.
Anyways, all I wanted to say was... it's way too dark under this truck.

attributes.content: (Patience, now. Just five more seconds. Wait for the shoes to go out of sight...)
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: (Four... three... two... one...)
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*! ...Blurgh!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Ugh... At least two mouthfuls of dirt won't send me to the hospital, even if this is the dried sand on the chassis we're talking about...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Alright, I can feel it. This should be the access door leading to the power room on the bottom level.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: It's too scary to walk around outside, so I squeezed back inside the vehicle to wait for them to return...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Though... I'm not sure if Ray's gonna be coming back... I feel bad leaving her behind like that, but it's not like I did it on purpose.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: One, two––
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Finally, the valve opened!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Oh no! S-S-S-Sorry! I got in the wrong vehicle!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I'll be leaving now...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Hold it.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Vehicle

attributes.content: I hear something coming from under the vehicle.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Vehicle

attributes.content: Oh no...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Shh—
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: (whispers) Quiet down.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: (whispers) If you blow my cover, nothing good's going to come of it.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: (Nods in silence)
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: We can't afford to let those damned metal crabs crawl into the station anymore! The last time one got in, it totaled three vehicles, and shanked two people to boot!
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Vehicle

attributes.content: Go grab a torch. I need to take a look.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Vehicle

attributes.content: (Gestures wildly in despair)
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: (whispers) Come out.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Yeah, I got these coupons from somebody else. I don't know much about your market here.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Then why the hell are you answering our market research questions?!
attributes.name: Uniformed Worker

attributes.content: Because you asked them.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Ugh, alright then. I guess we have to throw out that whole transcript. Sorry for bothering you, ma'am.
attributes.name: Uniformed Worker

attributes.content: No worries.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: 'Monthly promo magazine, clip this for 10% off compressed canned food.'
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: When did this kind of stuff start showing up?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Alanna is pretty incredible. She's got all the little details worked out in life, everything down the list.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: 'On Friday, go grab a scarf from the old man with a stuffed tail, and get a friends discount from his daughter.' Yeah. She's got everything figured out, down to the day.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: This stack of papers can be used in the Three Million Trolleys supermarket, and this stack...
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: That's right, Doctor. Actually, even my own memory is a bit fuzzy.
It's as if Rim Billiton has always been like this. Rusty factories, steel frames stacked on top of each other, a gray skyscape, and Originium clusters towering in the horizon...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Sorry, Amiya. I really would like for you to be able to go home and have a good look around... I was looking for your parents for a long while.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: But after the attack on the engineering team, the nomadic plate you used to live on got dismantled. The place we're standing right now probably has the most stuff from the old plate.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: No worries, Savage. This is enough. Thank you so much.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Just smelling the rust, oil, and welding rods is bringing back memories.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's as if... I've gone back in time.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh, what am I even saying...? It's only been a few years.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's just... I can still feel myself sitting in the back of a construction truck, following my parents and the other folks on the engineering team, waiting for them to set out from the plate.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's a common practice in many large families.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: The household oftentimes IS the engineering team. If the team has to go work in some faraway place, they'll take the old and the young with them, to make sure they're taken care of.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: Of course, not all the people in the family are necessarily blood-related. Sometimes, they'll be considered part of the household just by living in the same part of the factory.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: Oh, Doctor, there's no need to feel bad for me... It's not like I was thinking about the accident.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: And besides, I'd already carefully thought through what I was searching for, even before I came to Rim Billiton.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh, Doctor, look over there! I still remember that smokestack...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Erm...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: What's wrong, Amiya?
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: ...I suddenly remembered challenging the other kids to see who could crawl down there the farthest while keeping their tails as clean as possible...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Isn't that insanely dangerous?;Sounds like fun. I'd like to give it a try.

attributes.content: It was totally fine. None of us wanted to get scolded by the adults back home, so we never went too far down.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Crikey, when's the last time I heard Amiya talking like this?
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: I'm afraid you don't qualify, Doctor. You don't have a tail.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Crikey, when's the last time I heard Amiya talking like this?
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: I'm not the same six or seven-year-old kid I was back then either!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But, at last, I've found something I recognize.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This is still Rim Billiton after all.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: It's how we build our houses. Old buildings are incredibly useful, so there's no need to dismantle them. If you want a new house, just build right on top of it.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: Which is why the elders tell us from the time we're little...
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: ...'Adventurous folk, no matter how far they travel, always know home when they come back to it.'
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That being said, a lot of things have changed as well.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: For example, the Infected persons management law we just came across seems to be imitating Leithanien's legal framework and Victoria's jargon...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Someone's been staring at you for a while now.

attributes.content: Mmhmm. I've noticed, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I don't think I've seen her before... Also, I don't think any of the people who took care of me before would recognize me now.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Let's keep moving, Doctor. I'm sure it's fine.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: ...The coupon flyer and the shopping list to go with it have gotten all mixed up. Now, what did Alanna tell me to get again...?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: So that's the whole deal. The stretch from Windy Beach to the Grinning Valley is the most Catastrophe-prone place, say the Messengers. I've seen it myself too.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Oh? What's so special about the place?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Well, you could say that its ecology is–
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Is what?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ––Devoid of fowlshit.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Though Billy's natural geography is generally pretty barren to begin with, this area is SO barren that you won't even find fowlbeast droppings.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: You want an 'easy' route? Not even in your dreams. If you want a road paved for you, you can look towards the rocks raining from the sky.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: And don't expect to find anything fun to do either. All you find is the usual Billy stuff – ready to kill at the drop of a hat.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Alright, so other than the fowlbeasts that don't poop, any other special creatures to look out for?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Other creatures? Well, there's a scary number of sandbeasts. And listen to me here, you don't want anything to do with them. They'll mess you up!
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Sure, sure. Got it. Sandbeasts. Nothing unusual about those.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Isn't there anything a bit more... 'talkative,' 'shining,' 'incredibly huge,' anything along those lines?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: How would I know? I'm not even a professional explorer, let alone a cryptid biologist.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: C'mon, don't be in such a rush to shoo us away...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Lemme just ask you one last time.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: 'Rays of light.' 'A shadow as tall as a mountain.' 'Talking.' These words don't mean anything to you, right?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ––Say that again, one more time?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Rays of light. A shadow as tall as a mountain. Talks.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Nah, yeah. That's a thing.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: *sigh*... What a pain. In the end, I really did remember something for your sake.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: (Sargonian) 'Feranmut.'
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: What language is that?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Sargonian. Course, not many know the word to begin with.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Huh. Where's Sargonia?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I mean, that doesn't matter here. You should be using your precious time to tell me what that word means.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Huh? Didn't you hear what I just said? Almost nobody knows the word at all!
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: So, I've got no way of explaining it. Anything would just come out silly. Nobody's ever really studied exactly what a Feranmut is; it's just a vague concept that I happened to hear about.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Forget it, just act like you never heard anything from me. Don't even think about it, and certainly don't go throwing that word around. Nothing irks my tail more than fake news getting spread all over the place. I just end up running around for nothing.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Alright, alright. I'll forget you ever said anything.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Don't need your thanks or your words of praise. Your ten minutes are up, and the door is thataway. Are we clear?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Yeah, clear as day.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Although... I'm still going to thank you anyway. The first bit you said, that this is a thing, that's good enough for me.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Rays of light? Shadows as tall as mountains? Feranmuts?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Who the hell would believe anything so crazy?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: These made-up legends are growing out of control. People really oughta stop trying to mess with me.
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: How about... I finish these goddamn investigation reports and head on over to the Grinning Valley to take a look?
attributes.name: Asbestos

attributes.content: Whaddya think?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: If you're planning on going, then of course you have my full support! Even though I don't know anything about exploring or archaeology, there has to be some way I can help!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Huh? Nah, I was asking how you felt about getting kicked out after ten minutes.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Didn't you tag along so I wouldn't lose track of time chatting with my old friend? Looks like I didn't need your supervision.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: That's true, heehee.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You know, when you really can't muster a smile... you don't have to force yourself. Even just a bit.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: If you're tired and want to vent, I'll make sure nobody sees you.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Aaaaaaaaaaaaahhhh! I finally found a nice tunnel I can hide in! I'm saved!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hurry. Get your rear in there.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: As a friendly reminder, the left side's the sewage pipeline of the scalecis processing factory. I'd hop over to the other side, if I were you.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Thanks a million, Alanna!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Oh, wait. Fancy running into you here.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: (Raises an eyebrow)
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Um... I can explain...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I think someone's seen through our disguise and is setting up near the checkpoint. Ray seems to have gotten herself tangled up, but... I'm sure she has a way out.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Just a sec. The people chasing you are after us because of what we've done?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Uhh, I'm not too sure about that...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I, I mean, my thing definitely doesn't matter!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I just happened to be hiding in the wrong place, so I got caught up in this Keira's mess again...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Grab the rope, Jerry!
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Y-Yeah! Got it – I'll help you throw the knot over, and then you can lower me down!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...In any case, that's the situation, Alanna. Don't worry about me! Gotta run for now!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Did he actually get himself involved, or is he just running because he happened to see someone else running?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But y'know, Potlid, don't you the one next to him looks kinda familiar?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.text: Life really is terrifying. And you can't run away from it, no matter how much you might want to... Well, actually, I've never wanted to run away.

I always went with the flow, safely and securely, along with my thirty-six other siblings and the other three hundred thousand people in the city. After all, you naturally gravitate towards whatever's the most stable.
But I got attacked out of nowhere. I ended up skipping out on my engagement, and now I'm actually on the run with my very own two feet.
I don't know why, but, even as I'm being chased by all sorts of things and running for my life....
––In the end, a door always opens for me.

attributes.content: *pant*, *pant*... Are things getting better or worse for us?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Logically speaking, if there's a nest of metal crabs beneath the sewer, we ought to contact a security officer. That's what it says under the 'beware of wildlife' signs...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Bad news is, we just barged straight into their home in our attempt to escape.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Ha... Ahaha...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I can't feel my lungs anymore...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Don't slow down now! Unless you want to end cut to ribbons by those pincers!
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: I, I really can't deal with this whole running away thing...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Do I come across as some career criminal who's constantly on the run? I'm just...
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: ...I just wanted people to think I went missing, so I crawled into the bed of my hardware store's delivery truck and went to sleep for a day.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Then, the cargo box ended up getting transported away as usual and I found myself waking up in someone else's vehicle...
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: And here we are.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: You're not a career criminal? Thank goodness, I thought I saw your face somewhere before on a wanted poster.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Oh, b-but I don't mean to say that you look generic or ordinary...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: You know, I've had a question my mind. You really went and helped someone you thought was a wanted criminal?
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: I, I just felt like I had no choice... From the very beginning, I didn't know why those men were even chasing me...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Plus, I think you're actually a good egg. Same as the ladies who abducted me and brought me here. They're actually pretty decent...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Ugh! So loud...
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Hold on, where are we...?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...I've got an idea!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Let's hear it.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Huh? You're letting me call the shots? Th-This is rather new for me...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Long story short, that sound's the smelting plant's automatic waste filtration and disposal system. I've seen someone falling off it in one of our company ads, he suffered a terrible fracture...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...My point is, if people can fall from it, that also means there has to be a way up. We might be able to climb on top of that thing.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: There's no way the metal crabs could chase us up that high! And our pursuers would never expect us to leave the factory. Let's go this way!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: You want us to walk across these... rickety platforms that look like they could flip over at a moment's notice? Along these iron slabs that could easily send us flying?
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: It's not completely impossible! The robotic arms are on a timer! I'll climb up first and look for the control room. It'll be safe, as long as I manually operate the arms!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I saw Alanna driving the transport. The operating lever for this mechanical platform should be just like that vehicle's shifter...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I might be able to pull this off... I just need to give it a shot...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I mean... I can't say for sure if it's going to work or not, but...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I trust you. You can do it. Just go for it.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: You trust me? Wait... Not only are you willing to let me call the shots, but you're also placing your faith in me? Dear lord... not one of my thirty-six siblings has ever dared...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: But, you're also smart and independent, just like them––
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Um, I'm sorry, Keira... But, the platform's taller than I expected... I can't reach... Could you give me a little boost?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: A boost? Like this...? Here?
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Th-Th-That works too, b-but I was kind of thinking my back or legs or...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Woah, you're strong! Great, I made it up!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Awesome...
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: (Whispers) And you're nothing like the elders constantly trying to dictate my life.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: So what you're saying is, nobody's on to us, and nobody's tracking us.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You didn't kill anyone with this, did you?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Yeah, nah. There were so many things on your shopping list, I didn't have a free hand to draw my weapon.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Alright, as long as you didn't cause any trouble.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: *sigh*... I've had more than my fair share of excitement. That incident at the checkpoint was already hard enough on Potlid.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Where'd our resident coward go?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: We... Phew, we're finally safe. We actually did it...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Thank you. I really mean that. Thank you so much.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Haha... My timid heart's still ready to jump out of my ribcage... I, I actually followed through with a decision? And such a dangerous one at that?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Quit bashing yourself over the head with your briefcase already. People are staring.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Ugh, sorry... It's just that, I'm a lot more used to going along with other people's plans. I had a big family, and things got pretty loud...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Yeah, I get you. Most people are pretty much the same. Everyone joins in, and things get noisy, whether or not they're actually blood-related.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: It's been a good decade since one of my sisters went out to travel across the lands, and a lot of the others don't even remember that she left Rim Billiton.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: What I'm trying to say is, it's perfectly normal to be forgotten, just as it's perfectly normal for twenty or thirty people to suddenly remember you at once and start talking about the same things on repeat.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Haha, how right you are...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: You know, I skipped out on my engagement today, which is how I ended up out here. It's also why I'm so afraid of getting caught.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Well, actually, the whole thing was foisted onto me because of a little dust-up... But afterwards, I realized that I was pretty happy to be getting out of that marriage.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: It hadn't dawned upon me until then that I was really against the whole arrangement!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I don't even know the first thing about the woman I'm engaged to! I just felt like... so many smart people in the family said I should do it, so it had to be the right thing!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Right? I totally get you! The elders in my family always try to push their experiences onto me, and I got so sick and tired of their nagging that I wanted to disappear!
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Even though I left the old factories and went to Carrot's to an assembly line, they still packed themselves into a transport for a solid half day just to tell me that they 'found me a proper man.'
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: If I'd gone along with it, then I would've missed everything that happened today...
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...It's nothing. You go ahead.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Um... Keira, I'm just thinking, the two of us have a pretty good rapport... And, uh, my company recently rolled out a new insurance plan with really broad coverage...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I don't know if you'd be interested or not, but...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Huh? Insurance? I'd be glad to help you with your work, since I do owe you one for today... But, what kind of insurance are we talking about here? And how much does it cost?
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: N-N-N-No, Miss Keira, that's not what I meant... It won't cost you any money. I just wanted to ask...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...How would you feel about becoming the beneficiary of this insurance plan I just bought?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Beneficiary?
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: I-I-In other words, if anything happens to me, then the company will pay you a large sum of money... As for the specific terms, I can go over the details with you, if you have time...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: After all, a beneficiary is someone very important to me...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Goodness, what's gotten into me?! Am I making decisions for myself again? And I swear, this has to be the most important decision of my life!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Keira?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I know, this is all very sudden, but it's how I really feel, I just had to blurt it out...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: The old me would've just kept it bottled up in my heart, thinking over and over about how to get the words out, and if I did get them out, worrying if I stuttered or not. Huh? Am I not stuttering anymore...?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Oh! It's no big deal though... If you don't want to, then... Maybe I shouldn't have sprung it on you like that... Maybe, I...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I'll do it.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: It's more in line with my personal principals than going along with whatever the elders have planned for me.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Really...? You're fine with it? Oh my god! I really have to tell my siblings that I'm not going to let them lead me around by the nose forever.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Totally. They're always going on about how they've been through so much and know better... My whole family's got a suite of rules when it comes to who we marry.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Like how everyone loves a Cautus with long ears.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Huh? Cautus?
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Ah, yes. I'm the only Zalak in the family. I guess I got handed off to this family when I was little.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: I forget about that a lot, same as people forget about me. Besides... what big family isn't cobbled together like this?
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Ah, and they like loud talkers.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: My relatives are more into the quiet types.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: And industrious, businessy types.
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Who know how to make a sales pitch.
attributes.name: Strange Lady

attributes.content: Even their appearance...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Wait...
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...You just mentioned that you were skipping out on an engagement ceremony, didn't you?
attributes.name: Somewhat Familiar Woman

attributes.content: Lanns, if we don't leave now, we'll be surrounded by drivers bringing wine barrels over to collect bottletree water, and won't be able to get out...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I know that already.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Seriously, didn't that Zalak say he was scared to death that something terrible would happen as soon as he left the vehicle?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I told him everyone's free to get off whenever they want, and I wouldn't do anything to stop him.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Naw, the way he was talking, I think he was scared he'd run into the girl he was engaged to.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Ray! Alanna! Hurry up and give me your contact!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'll send you the details later! Wedding invitations!
attributes.name: Jerry

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: As far as I can tell, the road ahead should be pretty safe. No traces of big beasties, no sign of the ground getting hollowed out by the wildlife.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Haha. Maybe that last blessing the Zalak left you is actually doing something for us after all.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: 'Have a safe trip,' and 'you'll definitely find what you're looking for.'
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: 'Feranmut,' huh...?
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: Pretty tough, just going by the sound of that word, huh? If you walked up to me and told me, 'we're going to go find the Feranmut,' I wouldn't have questioned it for a moment.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Though, I didn't think you'd also read the road conditions.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hardly. I don't have much experience, I'm not a real lookout.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: I just think... looking out into the distance with binoculars is pretty neat, that's all.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: ––Weird.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The power system's temperature display seems a bit off.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Jacker, did we miss something just now?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Like, a geyser spewing steam by the side of the road, or active Originium on the surface causing a small-scale explosion?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: I made sure of it.
attributes.name: Ray

attributes.content: What about Potlid?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Where'd she get herself to while we were looking outside?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Wait, is she... in the power room?!
attributes.name: Alanna
